item.title: Mahindra XEV 9e, BE 6 top variant prices announced; Check battery range, features, booking dates here - The Economic Times
item.description:
Mahindra XEV 9e, BE 6 top variant prices announced; Check battery range, features, booking dates here

Date: Tuesday
Source: Economic Times

Introduction

Mahindra and Mahindra has unveiled the prices for its electric SUVs, the Mahindra XEV 9e and BE 6, with various options and features designed for consumers eager for electric vehicle options.

Key Points

  • The Mahindra XEV 9e is priced at Rs 30.90 lakh for the top variant with a 79 kWh battery.
  • The BE 6 top-spec variant will retail at Rs 26.9 lakh.
  • Bookings for both SUVs will commence on February 14, with test drives starting January 14.
  • Deliveries of the XEV 9e will begin in March 2025, while the BE 6 deliveries are expected in early March.
  • The XEV 9e features two battery options (59kWh and 79kWh) and claims a range of 656km on the MIDC cycle.
  • Both models come equipped with advanced technology like a three-screen setup, augmented reality head-up displays, and a comprehensive ADAS suite.

Notable Quotes or Statistics

“The 79kWh battery can be charged from 20 to 80 percent in 20 minutes using a 175kW DC fast charger.”

Conclusion

Mahindra’s new electric SUVs promise exciting features and competitive pricing, catering to the growing market for electric vehicles in India.

item.title: OYO Results: Hotels chain operator reports ₹114.64 crore net profit in FY2024, revenue drop 15% | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
OYO Results: Hotels chain operator reports ₹114.64 crore net profit in FY2024, revenue drop 15%

Date & Source: March 2024, Live Mint

OYO Hotels and Homes Pvt. Ltd. has reported a net profit for FY2024, despite a significant drop in operational revenue compared to the previous year.

  • The company reported a net profit of ₹114.64 crore for FY2024, an improvement from the previous year's loss.
  • Operational revenue decreased by 15%, totaling ₹1,112.83 crore.
  • OYO achieved its first positive EBITDA since 2020, reported at ₹153 crore.
  • Total revenue for March 2024 was ₹1,179 crore, compared to ₹1,400 crore in the previous year.
  • OYO's first-ever post-tax profit was ₹229 crore, exceeding earlier profit projections.
  • Earnings per share improved to approximately ₹0.36 from a loss of ₹1.93 per share in FY23.
  • The company expanded its hotel portfolio significantly, growing inventory from 12,938 to 18,103 hotels.
“The company's reported profits for FY24 significantly exceeded CEO Ritesh Agarwal's earlier projection of ₹100 crore.”

In conclusion, OYO's financial recovery in FY2024 is notable, highlighting a turnaround amidst declining revenue but with an expansion in its hotel operations.

item.title: NCLAT approves merger between Equinox India and Embassy Group - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
item.description:
NCLAT Approves Merger of Equinox India and Embassy Group

Published on: 07 Jan 2025, 2:08 pm

The National Company Law Appellate Tribunal (NCLAT) has approved the merger between Equinox India Developments and Embassy Group, overturning a previous NCLT ruling that halted the merger.

  • The NCLAT ruled against objections raised by a minor shareholder regarding the merger.
  • The process received overwhelming support from 99.9987% of equity shareholders.
  • The merger was assessed and approved by the Competition Commission of India.
  • Valuation discrepancies raised by the Income Tax Department were addressed satisfactorily.
  • The NCLAT emphasized the judicial wisdom of shareholders and creditors in approving the scheme.
“After going through the facts and circumstances... we hold that Ld. NCLT, Chandigarh has erred in interfering in the Scheme ignoring the commercial wisdom of shareholders...”

The ruling allows the merger to proceed while stating that the Income Tax Department can still take action to protect revenue interests.

item.title: Mark Zuckerberg's Meta to replace third-party fact-checkers with community notes like ‘X’ - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Meta's Shift: Community Notes Replace Third-Party Fact-Checkers

Date: Jan 07, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Meta has announced plans to replace its third-party fact-checking program with a community notes system, similar to the model on X (formerly Twitter), starting in the United States. This decision is based on the belief that expert fact-checkers carry biases and contribute to a loss of trust.

  • Meta will begin scrapping the third-party fact-checking program in the US.
  • Mark Zuckerberg highlighted that fact-checkers have been politically biased.
  • The new community notes approach aims to empower users in determining misleading posts.
  • Meta plans to allow more speech by lifting restrictions on certain topics.
  • Zuckerberg expressed that recent US elections signify a cultural shift towards prioritizing speech.
  • Meta intends to move its trust and safety teams from California to Texas to combat perceived bias.
  • The company will also reverse its 2021 policy that reduced political content visibility.
“We're going to get rid of fact-checkers and replace them with community notes similar to X (formerly Twitter), starting in the US.” - Mark Zuckerberg

This shift reflects Meta's effort to restore trust and move towards a more community-driven approach in content moderation.

item.title: Getty Images and Shutterstock to merge to form $3.7B stock photo giant - TechCrunch
item.description:
Getty Images and Shutterstock to merge to form $3.7B stock photo giant

Publication Date: Tuesday, January 3, 2025   |   Source: TechCrunch

Getty Images has announced a merger with rival Shutterstock in a deal valued at $3.7 billion, allowing Getty to own approximately 54.7% of the new company.

  • The merger combines the strengths of both companies in the stock photo and video footage market.
  • Shutterstock shareholders can choose between cash or stock options as part of the deal.
  • The merger comes amid a changing landscape for the stock image industry due to the rise of artificial intelligence.
  • Concerns exist about potential antitrust scrutiny of the merger.
“Today’s announcement is exciting and transformational for our companies, unlocking multiple opportunities to strengthen our financial foundation and invest in the future,” said Getty Images CEO Craig Peters.

This merger is positioned to reshape the stock image industry significantly, amidst both opportunities and threats posed by emerging technologies.

item.title: Upcoming Hyundai Creta Is Now Safer! - MotorOctane
item.description:
Upcoming Hyundai Creta Is Now Safer!

Date: Recent

Source: MotorOctane

Hyundai is gearing up to launch its new Creta EV in India, enhancing its safety features to meet buyer demands.

  • The new Creta EV will feature more than 75 advanced safety features, with 52 as standard across all variants.
  • The vehicle includes a level 2 ADAS suite and is built with advanced high-strength steel for better protection.
  • Safety features such as six airbags, Hill Start and Descent Control, and a 360-degree view camera will be part of the package.
  • Interiors feature advanced technologies including an in-car payment system and dual 10.25-inch screens.
  • The EV offers two battery options (51.4 kWh generating 169 bhp and 42 kWh generating 133 bhp) and ranges of 473 km and 390 km, respectively.
  • Hyundai aims to attract previous buyers who found the Creta lacking in safety.
“The new model gets more than 75 advanced safety features out of which 52 are standard across all variants.”

This new iteration of the Hyundai Creta not only enhances safety but also modernizes the SUV, potentially capturing the attention of safety-conscious consumers.

item.title: FD interest rates: These top 7 banks offer the highest rates on 5-year fixed deposits | Mint - Mint
item.description:
FD interest rates: These top 7 banks offer the highest rates on 5-year fixed deposits

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Live Mint

Bank Regular (%) Senior citizens (%)
HDFC Bank 7 7.5
ICICI 7 7.5
Axis 7 7.75
Yes Bank 7.25 8
SBI 6.5 7.5
Bank of Baroda 6.8 7.4
PNB 6.5 7

This article discusses the importance of comparing fixed deposit interest rates across banks to maximize savings. An increase of just 50 basis points can lead to significant savings over time, especially for long-term deposits.

  • HDFC and ICICI Banks lead with 7% rates for regular citizens.
  • Yes Bank offers the highest rate of 8% for senior citizens.
  • SBI and PNB provide lower rates compared to private banks.
"An extra 50 basis points on a two-year FD of ₹5 lakh can enable you to save an extra ₹5,000."

In conclusion, being mindful of interest rate differences among banks can significantly enhance wealth accumulation through fixed deposits.

item.description:
OYO Results: Hotels chain operator reports ₹114.64 crore net profit in FY2024, revenue drop 15%

OYO Hotels and Homes Pvt. Ltd. has reported a net profit for FY2024, despite a significant drop in operational revenue compared to the previous year.

  • The company reported a net profit of ₹114.64 crore for FY2024, an improvement from the previous year's loss.
  • Operational revenue decreased by 15%, totaling ₹1,112.83 crore.
  • OYO achieved its first positive EBITDA since 2020, reported at ₹153 crore.

item.title: Meta drops fact-checking and loosens its content moderation rules - TechCrunch
item.description:
Meta drops fact-checking, loosens its content moderation rules

Date: January 2025 | Source: TechCrunch

Meta, the parent company of Facebook, Instagram, and WhatsApp, has announced significant changes to its content moderation policies, including the end of its third-party fact-checking program.

  • The third-party fact-checking program will be replaced by a Community Notes model.
  • Restrictions on mainstream discussion topics will be lifted, focusing instead on illegal and severe violations.
  • Users will be encouraged to personalize their political content, allowing for more opinion-based feeds.
“Meta’s platforms are built to be places where people can express themselves freely.” - Joel Kaplan, Chief Global Affairs Officer

These changes come as Meta adjusts to a new political landscape in the U.S., aiming to balance free expression with moderation while responding to public criticism of its previous policies.

item.title: Stock market today: BSE Sensex ends over 230 points up; Nifty50 above 23,700 - The Times of India
item.description:
Stock market today: BSE Sensex ends over 230 points up; Nifty50 above 23,700

Date: Today

Source: Times of India

The stock market saw a recovery today after two consecutive days of declines, driven by strong buying in major stocks and positive sentiment in global markets.

  • The BSE Sensex rose by 234.12 points, closing at 78,199.11.
  • The NSE Nifty increased by 91.85 points, ending at 23,707.90.
  • Key contributors to the rise included Reliance Industries, ICICI Bank, and L&T.
  • IT sector stocks faced declines ahead of earnings announcements.
  • The rupee depreciated against the dollar, closing at 85.73.
  • FIIs sold shares worth Rs 2,575.06 crore on Monday.
"Asian markets ended mixed, with Seoul, Tokyo, and Shanghai closing higher, whilst Hong Kong declined."

In conclusion, the stock market rebounded today, showing resilience amid recent volatility, but faced challenges with specific sectors under pressure.

item.title: India’s GDP growth likely slowed to 6.4% in FY25 compared to 8.2% last year: Government estimates - The Times of India
item.description:
India’s GDP growth likely slowed to 6.4% in FY25 compared to 8.2% last year: Government estimates

Date: January 7, 2025 | Source: Times of India

The Indian government recently released estimates indicating that the GDP growth rate for the fiscal year 2025 is expected to slow to 6.4%, a significant drop from 8.2% in the previous year. This slowdown raises concerns about economic stability and growth prospects in the country.

  • The GDP growth rate is projected to fall to 6.4% for FY25.
  • This is a decrease from the 8.2% growth rate recorded in FY24.
  • Experts suggest various factors, including inflation and global economic conditions, are impacting growth.
  • The government is expected to implement measures to stimulate the economy.
"The reduction in GDP growth highlights the challenges facing the Indian economy moving forward." - Economic Analyst

The shift to a lower growth forecast underscores the imperative for reforms to bolster economic performance in the coming years.

item.title: India's GDP growth seen to slow sharply to 6.4% in FY25 from 8.2% last year, first advance estimate shows - The Economic Times

item.title: Top Tech Trends of 2025: AI-powered everything - Capgemini
item.description:
Top Tech Trends 2025: A Comprehensive Overview

Date: 2024-12-01
Source: Capgemini

This report explores five critical technology trends that are expected to shape the business landscape in 2025. It emphasizes understanding emerging technologies for future planning.

  • Generative AI's impact on various industries
  • The evolving role of AI in cybersecurity
  • AI-driven robotics enhancing productivity
  • Implications of nuclear energy advancements for sustainability
  • Evolution of agile, greener supply chain management

“In 2025, we see AI and Gen AI having a major impact on companies’ priorities and also on many adjacent technology domains.” - Pascal Brier

This comprehensive analysis provides insights for business leaders on navigating the complexity of future technology trends.

item.title: ISB student orders from Blinkit, Swiggy and Zepto to see who delivers first. Guess who won - Hindustan Times
item.description:
ISB Student Compares Quick Delivery Services: Who Delivered First?

Date: Jan 07, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

A student at the Indian School of Business (ISB), Hyderabad, conducted a contest among Blinkit, Swiggy Instamart, and Zepto to judge which service could deliver their orders the fastest. The results amused thousands of viewers as she posted her findings on X.

  • The student ordered two protein bars from Blinkit, a milk packet from Swiggy Instamart, and paneer from Zepto.
  • Blinkit estimated a delivery time of 13 minutes while Swiggy Instamart promised 21 minutes and Zepto claimed it would take 8 minutes.
  • Blinkit was the fastest, delivering the protein bars in 15 minutes.
  • Swiggy Instamart followed in 20 minutes, while Zepto took the longest at 30 minutes, despite its initial 8-minute promise.
“Some quick lessons: Promised times? Take them with a pinch of salt. Store location matters A LOT. Delivery folks deserve all the credit for making this possible.”

This experiment collected over 70,000 views, generating significant discussion about the reliability of delivery timelines provided by these services.

item.title: Microsoft announces US $3bn investment over two years in India cloud and AI infrastructure to accelerate adoption of AI, skilling and innovation - Microsoft
item.description:
Microsoft announces US $3bn investment over two years in India cloud and AI infrastructure to accelerate adoption of AI, skilling and innovation

Date: January 7, 2025 | Source: Microsoft Stories India

Microsoft has announced a significant investment aimed at enhancing AI and cloud capabilities in India, emphasizing the importance of skilling and infrastructure development.

  • Microsoft plans to invest $3 billion in India for cloud and AI infrastructure over two years.
  • The goal is to train 10 million individuals in AI skills by 2030.
  • Establishment of new datacenters to support growing AI needs in India.
“India is rapidly becoming a leader in AI innovation, unlocking new opportunities across the country.” - Satya Nadella

This investment sets the stage for India to become an AI-first nation while fostering innovation and entrepreneurship across various sectors.

item.title: HDFC Bank cuts lending rate by 5 bps, check the latest rates | Mint - Mint
item.description:
HDFC Bank Cuts Lending Rate by 5 Basis Points

Publication Date: January 7, 2025

Source: Live Mint

HDFC Bank has decreased its marginal cost of funds-based lending rate (MCLR) by up to 5 basis points, effective from January 7, 2025. The new MCLR rates will range between 9.15 percent and 9.45 percent.

Key Points:

  • MCLR rates now range between 9.15% and 9.45%
  • Effective from January 7, 2025
  • MCLR rates impact loan EMIs accordingly
  • Benchmark PLR set at 17.95% and base rate at 9.45%
“When MCLR rates are raised, loan EMIs also typically go higher.”

This cut in lending rates will likely make loans more accessible to borrowers, impacting consumer borrowing positively.

item.title: Is QuantumScape ex-CEO Jagdeep Singh's salary highest in the world with Rs 48 cr daily earnings? Here is TRUTH behind viral trend | ET NOW VERIFIED - ET Now
item.description:
Is QuantumScape ex-CEO Jagdeep Singh's salary highest in the world with Rs 48 cr daily earnings?

Date: January 7, 2025
Source: ET NOW VERIFIED

Recently, multiple media reports claimed that Jagdeep Singh is the world's highest-paid executive, allegedly earning Rs 48 crore daily. However, investigations revealed that this claim lacks factual basis.

  • Media reports misreported Singh as the highest-paid executive.
  • No credible evidence supports the claim of Rs 48 crore daily earnings.
  • When leaving the CEO position, Singh waived his compensation.
  • QuantumScape confirmed that Singh will no longer receive compensation effective February 15, 2024.
  • Dr. Siva Sivaram has been appointed as the new CEO.
“Founding QuantumScape has been the highlight of my career. I profoundly believe in the mission and the success of this company and team.” - Jagdeep Singh

ETNow.in confirmed that there is no evidence to suggest that Jagdeep Singh holds the title of the highest-paid executive worldwide.

item.title: Quadrant Future Tek IPO Day 1 Live Updates: Issue booked 12.10x so far, retail portion subscribed 44.38x. Check GMP | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Quadrant Future Tek IPO Day 1 Live Updates: Issue booked 13.45x so far, retail portion subscribed 48.32x. Check GMP

Date: 07 Jan, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

The Quadrant Future Tek IPO, valued at ₹290 crore, has opened for public subscription with strong initial interest. The retail portion has seen significant booking, with multiple stages of interest reported throughout the day.

  • The IPO consists solely of a new issue worth up to ₹290 crore.
  • Price band set between ₹275-290 per share, open for subscription from January 7 to January 9.
  • Over ₹130 crore secured from anchor investors prior to the public subscription.
  • Retail investors subscribed 48.32 times, with total issue booked 13.45 times as of the latest updates.
  • Funds from the IPO will be used for long-term working capital needs and capital expenditures.
“The company's IPO has garnered substantial interest from retail and institutional investors, indicating strong market confidence.”

This IPO is a promising opportunity focused on India's railway safety systems and signaling technology, a sector expected to grow significantly over the coming years.

item.title: One Mobikwik Systems shares climb over 14% after Q2 results announcement - Mint
item.description:
One Mobikwik Systems Shares Surge 14% Following Q2 Earnings Release

Date: January 7, 2024 | Source: Live Mint

MobiKwik shares experienced a significant rise following the announcement of its Q2 earnings, marking a milestone for the company post-IPO.

The share price climbed 14 percent to ₹638 on January 7, 2024, following the earnings announcement for the quarter ending September 2024. This was MobiKwik's first quarterly results release since its market debut in December 2024.

  • MobiKwik's share price is now 129% above its IPO issue price of ₹279.
  • The company reported a net loss of ₹3.5 crore for Q2, down from a profit of ₹5.2 crore in the same period last year.
  • Operational revenue increased by 43% year-on-year, reaching ₹291 crore.
  • Investments are focused on driving growth despite the incurred losses.
  • MobiKwik serves 161 million registered users and has a merchant network of 4.3 million.
MobiKwik commands a 23.11% market share in India’s PPI wallet segment as of May 2024.

In conclusion, despite current losses, MobiKwik continues to show strong growth potential and adapt its strategies to capture the digital payment market in India.

item.title: Space race: Toyota invests $44 million in rocket startup amid Japan govt push for private sector | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
Toyota Invests $44 Million in Rocket Startup Amid Japan's Private Sector Push

Publication Date: January 7, 2024   Source: Live Mint

The global space race is accelerating as Toyota Motor Corporation invests in the Japanese startup Interstellar Technologies, aiming to enhance Japan's space industry.

  • Toyota invests $44 million in Interstellar Technologies to mass produce lightweight rockets.
  • The investment is part of a broader initiative to innovate in transportation, not limited to automotive.
  • The Japanese government encourages private sector involvement in expanding the country's space capabilities.
  • Toyota previously collaborated with JAXA to build a lunar rover for NASA's Artemis program.
  • Japan aims for 30 space launches per year by 2030, requiring a significant transformation of the domestic space industry.
“The future of mobility shouldn’t be limited to just cars.” - Akio Toyoda, Toyota Chairman

This investment represents a strategic move for Toyota and Japan to remain competitive in the evolving space sector, highlighting the importance of public-private partnerships.

item.title: Stocks to buy for short term: Mehta Equities' Riyank Arora suggests these 3 shares to buy amid HMPV virus cases in India | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Stocks to buy for short term: Mehta Equities’ Riyank Arora suggests these 3 shares to buy amid HMPV virus cases in India

Publication Date: Not Specified Source: Live Mint

The Indian stock market showed signs of recovery on Tuesday despite earlier setbacks, with analysts suggesting three key stocks for short-term investment amidst ongoing concerns about the human metapneumovirus (HMPV) outbreak.

Key Points

  • The Nifty 50 rose by 0.36% to 23,700.80 points.
  • BSE Sensex climbed 0.19% to 78,109.41.
  • Analysts expect quarterly earnings to influence stock market direction.
  • Market recovery is contingent on a favorable budget and interest rate reductions.
  • Riyank Arora recommends buying:
    • Enviro Infra Engineers Ltd
    • Oil and Natural Gas Corporation Ltd (ONGC)
    • Tata Motors Ltd

Notable Quotes or Statistics

“A strict stop loss at ₹289 for Enviro Infra Engineers is recommended to manage risks effectively.”
“A sustained hold above ₹49,500 could lead to a recovery toward ₹51,000 and beyond.”

Conclusion

The current market sees volatility spurred by health concerns, but with strategic stock selections and careful monitoring, investors can find opportunities even in a challenging environment.

item.title: Suzlon share price jumps after the green energy company’s reply on stock movement | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Suzlon Share Price Jumps Following Clarification on Stock Movement

Date: January 7, 2025 | Source: Mint

Suzlon share price increased by over 3% after a period of decline, following the company's response regarding its stock price volatility.

  • Suzlon shares saw a rebound of 3.65%, reaching ₹61.03 on the BSE.
  • Prior to the increase, shares closed at a 5% lower circuit the day before.
  • The stock had fallen over 10% in the previous three trading sessions.
  • Suzlon clarified that no specific event caused the stock's fluctuations, attributing it to a Material Price Movement (MPM).
  • Despite a 14% decline in three months, shares have risen 50% in the past year and delivered 495% returns over two years.
“This is to inform that a Material Price Movement (“MPM”) has been noticed in the scrip of Suzlon Energy Limited... however we could not ascertain any event or information in the mainstream media which could have triggered this MPM,” - Suzlon Energy

In conclusion, while Suzlon's recent performance shows volatility, the long-term returns remain significant for investors.

item.title: ITI shares soar over 25% in a week. Bull rally may continue but caution suggested - The Economic Times
item.description:
ITI shares soar over 25% in a week. Bull rally may continue but caution suggested

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: ETMarkets.com

Shares of ITI Ltd have shown impressive growth, surging by nearly 26% over the past week, reaching an all-time high of Rs 592.85 on the BSE.

  • The stock transitioned from a consolidation phase where it traded between Rs 225 and Rs 390 from October 2023 to December 2024, to a significant upward movement.
  • Analysts recommend setting a stop-loss at Rs 470 for current position holders and advise caution for new investors.
  • The stock is currently above major moving averages, signaling a bullish trend, but showing signs of being overbought according to the RSI.
  • Possible future targets are Rs 589 and Rs 614 based on Fibonacci extensions.
“Given the recent surge, existing position holders should set a stop-loss at Rs 470 and trail it as the stock rises,” advises Ajit Mishra, SVP of Research at Religare Broking.

The current price movement suggests a potentially overbought condition, implying some profit booking may occur at higher levels.

item.title: Gold bulls seem non-committed amid Fed's hawkish signal - FXStreet
item.description:
Gold Bulls Show Uncertainty Amid Fed's Hawkish Signals

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: FXStreet

The gold price is showing a mild positive bias but struggles to gain momentum due to geopolitical risks and the Federal Reserve's hawkish stance.

  • Gold attracts haven flows amid concerns about US trade policies.
  • The Fed’s hawkish stance caps potential gains for gold amidst rising bond yields.
  • Traders are waiting for FOMC minutes and Nonfarm Payrolls reports.
“Despite significant progress in lowering price pressures, inflation remains uncomfortably above the 2% target.” - San Francisco Fed President Mary Daly

The current market environment reflects caution among traders as they assess both geopolitical tensions and forthcoming economic reports, indicating potential volatility in gold prices.
